Calculator

The Calculator class contains the framework for user plugin interactions using data classes CalculatorContext and CalculatorCommand

class symcalc.Calculator(context=None, command_prefix='/')

A calculator based on SymPy

Parameters

  • context (CalculatorContext) –

  • command_prefix (str) –

handle_error_output(data)

Method for handling error output passed to the console interpreter. Given to plugins

Return type

None

register_plugin(plugin)

Register the given plugin. Returns itself for chaining

Parameters

plugin (symcalc.plugin.CalculatorPlugin) –

Return type

symcalc.calc.Calculator

Parameters

command_data (symcalc.command.CalculatorCommand) –

interact(prompt='Calculator')

Start an interactive prompt with the calculator. Exits on EOF, in which case the program should clean up and exit

Parameters

prompt (str) –

Return type

NoReturn

class symcalc.CalculatorContext

Contains all of the available methods and variables in a class. CalculatorContext.__dict__ works similarly to globals()

Return type

None

class symcalc.CalculatorCommand(calc, command)

Data for a single calculator command

Parameters

Return type

None
